meanings.definition: The electronic systems used in aircraft.
meanings.sent1: The avionics in the plane help the pilot navigate safely.
meanings.sent2: The avionics on the dashboard display vital information about the flight.
meanings.sent3: The avionics decided to play a prank on the autopilot by flickering the lights.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was like a complex network of avionics, processing information at lightning speed.
meanings.sent5: The avionics hummed softly, a symphony of technology guiding the aircraft through the sky.

meanings.definition: The science and technology of electronic devices used in aviation.
meanings.sent1: Studying avionics involves learning about radar and communication systems.
meanings.sent2: Avionics experts work tirelessly to improve aircraft safety and efficiency.
meanings.sent3: The avionics professor had a magnetic personality that attracted students to the subject.
meanings.sent4: In the world of aviation, avionics is the heartbeat that keeps planes flying smoothly.
meanings.sent5: The intricate dance of avionics and mechanics creates the magic of flight.
